page.title: 17New Roads-Horndon-on-Hill
page.content: The B.1007 was opened in October 1984 from the Stanford interchange. Its purpose is to allow traffic to bypass Horndon. The previous road into Horndon from the old A.13 was blocked off at Rookery Corner and the new A.13 cuts across it. The Orsett Road and the B.1007 are now the two main exits from Horndon. A new bridge has been built at Rookery Corner to carry pedestrians over the new A.13. The section of the new A.13 from Orset Cock roundabout to Stanford-le-Hope interchange was opened on June 28th, three months early. Horndon will now have less traffic coming though from Orset to Basildon to avoid the bottlenecks on the old A.13. The people who live in Horndon will find life much quieter and more pleasant.
